alert.note: Alert for Greater Oconee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:32PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Franklin, Stephens, northwestern Hart and southwestern Oconee Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 231 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Toccoa, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Toccoa, Seneca, Westminster, Lavonia, Gumlog, Martin, Avalon, Tugaloo State Park, Reed Creek and Oakway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
